ygData.subject: Re: Use for Lullaby at L17...
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve been noticing this in Highpass fighting orcs. We re all attacking the same mob, so I Lullbay them. (if we get a massive spawn).  I count the nods, and
ygData.messageBody:
I've been noticing this in Highpass fighting orcs.

We're all attacking the same mob, so I Lullbay them. (if we get a massive
spawn). I count the nods, and sure enough, all the mobs are lulled.
Obviously the one we're attackig doesn't stay lulled, but neither do some
other ones, even though they've got the nod message showing them as being
sleeping, and keep getting it displayed. No one is attacking them either,
no AE spells, etc.

Frustrating, to say the least. Reduces my crowd control ability immensely.

-Gaelaian Galaenor
-Pondering bard of the 20th song
-Tunare.

> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Yeah, I used to do this too but about a month ago or so it stopped
working.
> My charisma is 117 so it's not like I some poor human with minimum stats
> here. At level 21 I can sleep the green gnolls on reaver hill about 50%
of
> the time they don't resist. This was where I first noticed that it was
> broken. It used to work the way you describe and when I first got it I
> could solo the small bandit camp in lesser fay by sleeping the bandits I
> wasn't attacking just as you say. Now, I'd get waxed easily and I'm 6
> levels higher. It just does not work the way it is supposed to anymore,
and
> since nothing has ever been said by Verant and the nods message is
unchanged
> I assume its broken. Wiser heads than mine have noticed this. John Kim
is
> a very successful bard and yet he has seen this and documented it before I
> noticed it. I started using it again after he reported it being broken
and
> found that he was correct.
>
> Kitasi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: SteelWolf [mailto:steelwolf@...]
> Sent: Saturday, December 04, 1999 9:25 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Use for Lullaby at L17...
>
>
> From: SteelWolf <steelwolf@...>
>
> Possible use for lullaby at L17...
>
> A friend on his L17 Bard, and I on my 19 shaman were in East Karana
> killing gnoll reavers and undead reavers. He'd go pull 2-4 and come
> back. He'd use lullaby to keep them all asleep except for the one he was
> attacking. The paladin with us used /assist to target the correct
> target, then tanked it. At the beginning of the fight, I AE'd the mobs
> with Infectious Cloud, a Disease AE DoT. Next pulse he'd put them right
> back to sleep, nixing me off the hate list so I could heal or med
> without being mobbed. By the time the first target was dead, the other
> 2-3 targets would have been chewed to half health by the AE everytime.
> It was quite a sight.
>
> Two things to keep in mind however, his stats were much higher than a
> new player on a L17 because he was outfitted with better equipment, and
> he'd also played with many bards all the way to L50 in group on his
> primary character, so he'd been able to see Bards in action and ask many
> questions about the techniques and tricks of others.
>
> Ariell Thunderwolf, Karana
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
